verses.roman:
vṛndāvanaṁ govardhanaṁ
yamunā-pulināni ca
vīkṣyāsīd uttamā prītī
rāma-mādhavayor nṛpa

synonyms: vṛndāvanam—the place known as Vṛndāvana; govardhanam—along with Govardhana Hill; yamunā-pulināni ca—and the banks of the River Yamunā; vīkṣya—seeing this situation; āsīt—remained or was enjoyed; uttamā prītī—first-class pleasure; rāma-mādhavayoḥ—of Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma; nṛpa—O King Parīkṣit.
translation: O King Parīkṣit, when Rāma and Kṛṣṇa saw Vṛndāvana, Govardhana and the banks of the River Yamunā, They both enjoyed great pleasure.
